document_title: Corneal ulcers: Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_content: A corneal ulcer is an emergency that requires immediate treatment.; Antibiotic, antiviral or antifungal eye drops are often needed immediately and must be applied regularly, sometimes hourly for several days.; Dilating eye drops, such as atropine or scopolamine, may help relieve pain and reduce the risk of complications.; Corneal transplant
subsection_data:
viem loet giac mac.json. Treatment
A corneal ulcer is an emergency that requires immediate treatment.; Antibiotic, antiviral or antifungal eye drops are often needed immediately and must be applied regularly, sometimes hourly for several days.; Dilating eye drops, such as atropine or scopolamine, may help relieve pain and reduce the risk of complications.; Corneal transplant
